mainEntity.name: How do I verify crash game fairness?

acceptedAnswer.text: Place a bet, copy server seed/client seed/nonce, use the casino's verification tool, confirm the result matches the actual crash point. If it doesn't, the game is rigged.

mainEntity.name: Can crash games be rigged even if they're 'provably fair'?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes. Scammers fake provably fair with fake hashes, predictable client seeds, or fake verification tools. Always verify yourself by running 1,000+ rounds and calculating actual RTP.
Document everything (screenshots, seed data), contact support (give 24 hours), escalate to licensor if unresolved, post publicly to warn others, and leave immediately.

mainEntity.name: Do all crash casinos have provably fair?

acceptedAnswer.text: No. Some casinos have no provably fair system (avoid these). Legit crash casinos (Stake, BC.Game, Roobet, etc.) all have verifiable provably fair.

mainEntity.name: How do I know if provably fair is real?

acceptedAnswer.text: Check if server seed is hashed and disclosed BEFORE you bet, if client seed is user-generated, and if you can verify results yourself. If any of these are missing, provably fair is fake.

mainEntity.name: Can I verify crash games on mobile?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, most casinos have mobile verification tools. The process is the same (My Bets → Verify → Paste seed data → Check result).
